title: Kerning Advice
content:
How would you handle letterspacing on this word - particularly the “LVA”.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113055856im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/salvando_4584.png)

This is part of a Spanish headline (30pt. Eurostile Bold Extended), it just doesnt look right to me. Any wisdom you could impart would be greatly appreciated.

 [‹ TYPE ADVICE](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113055856/http:/www.typophile.com/node/28335 "Go to previous forum topic") [What are your pet peeves about common typefaces? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113055856/http:/www.typophile.com/node/28078 "Go to next forum topic")
author: GraphicFuzz

comments.content:
In my opinion the L needs to be slightly closer to the V and the second A needs to move away from the V. Once you’ve done that you might then need to open up NDO.

Rob

Move the first “A” a hair to the left.  
Move the “V” slightly to the left.  
Space out the “NDO” a hair.  
Look again.

BTW, if this is for print, higher res please.

hhp
I’d err on the side of loose over tight with such a sad letter combination. IMHO
I will make adjustments. Thank you for lending your eyes and brains.
